acknowledgments.summary: Dan Regalado from Zingbox reported this vulnerability to NCCIC.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to capture firmware updates through network traffic, extract credentials from the firmware, record video conversations, and may allow remote code execution with root privileges.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC recommends that users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-18-114-01 - Web Scraped Version

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

notes.text: An attacker may be able to capture firmware updates through the adjacent network. CVE-2018-8860 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Vecna has released a recommended update to mitigate the vulnerabilities. Vecna recommends the following update process:
Vecna may have released an update for CVE-2018-8858.
Vecna has not addressed CVE-2018-17931 and CVE-2018-17933.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS-CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT website.

notes.text: User accounts may be able to execute commands that are outside the scope of their privileges and within the scope of an admin account. If an attacker has access to VGo XAMPP Client credentials, they may be able to execute admin commands on the connected robot.CVE-2018-17933 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Vecna has released a recommended update to mitigate the vulnerabilities. Vecna recommends the following update process:
Vecna may have released an update for CVE-2018-8858.
Vecna has not addressed CVE-2018-17931 and CVE-2018-17933.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS-CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT website.

notes.text: If an attacker has physical access to the VGo Robot they may be able to alter scripts, which may allow code execution with root privileges.CVE-2018-17931 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:P/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Vecna has released a recommended update to mitigate the vulnerabilities. Vecna recommends the following update process:
Vecna may have released an update for CVE-2018-8858.
Vecna has not addressed CVE-2018-17931 and CVE-2018-17933.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS-CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT website.

notes.text: If an attacker has access to the firmware they may be able to extract credentials.CVE-2018-8858  has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 4.7 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:N/A:N)
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
